BitField.Name: VERSION[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Version number.

BitField.Name: ID[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Instance identifier number.

BitField.Name: SCRATCH[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Scratch register.

BitField.Name: MMCM_RSTN
BitField.Notes: MMCM reset only (required for DRP access). Reset, default is IN-RESET (0x0), software must write 0x1 to bring up the core.

BitField.Name: RSTN
BitField.Notes: Reset, default is IN-RESET (0x0), software must write 0x1 to bring up the core.

BitField.Name: R1_MODE
BitField.Notes: Select number of RF channels 1 (0x1) or 2 (0x0).

BitField.Name: DDR_EDGESEL
BitField.Notes: Select rising edge (0x0) or falling edge (0x1) for the first part of a sample (if applicable) followed by the successive edges for the remaining parts. This only controls how the sample is delineated from the incoming data post DDR registers.

BitField.Name: PIN_MODE
BitField.Notes: Select interface pin mode to be clock multiplexed (0x1) or pin multiplexed (0x0). In clock multiplexed mode, samples are received on alternative clock edges. In pin multiplexed mode, samples are interleaved or grouped on the pins at the same clock edge.

BitField.Name: CLK_FREQ[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Interface clock frequency. This is relative to the processor clock and in many cases is 100MHz. The number is represented as unsigned 16.16 format. Assuming a 100MHz processor clock the minimum is 1.523kHz and maximum is 6.554THz. The actual interface clock is CLK_FREQ * CLK_RATIO (see below). Note that the actual sampling clock may not be the same as the interface clock- software must consider device specific implementation parameters to calculate the final sampling clock.

BitField.Name: CLK_RATIO[31:0]
BitField.Notes: Interface clock ratio - as a factor actual received clock. This is implementation specific and depends on any serial to parallel conversion and interface type (ddr/sdr/qdr).

BitField.Name: PN_ERR
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates pn error in one or more channels.

BitField.Name: PN_OOS
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates pn oos in one or more channels.

BitField.Name: OVER_RANGE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates over range in one or more channels.

BitField.Name: STATUS
BitField.Notes: Interface status, if set indicates no errors. If not set, there are errors, software may try resetting the cores.

BitField.Name: DELAY_SEL
BitField.Notes: Delay select, a 0x0 to 0x1 transition in this register initiates a delay access controlled by the registers below.

BitField.Name: DELAY_RWN
BitField.Notes: Delay read (0x1) or write (0x0), the delay is accessed directly (no increment or decrement) with an address corresponding to each pin, and data corresponding to the total delay.

BitField.Name: DELAY_ADDRESS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: Delay address, the range depends on the interface pins, data pins are usually at the lower range.

BitField.Name: DELAY_WDATA[4:0]
BitField.Notes: Delay write data, a value of 1 corresponds to (1/200)ns for most devices.

BitField.Name: DELAY_LOCKED
BitField.Notes: Indicates delay locked (0x1) state. If this bit is read 0x0, delay control has failed to calibrate the elements.

BitField.Name: DELAY_STATUS
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates busy status (access pending). The read data may not be valid if this bit is set.

BitField.Name: DELAY_RDATA[4:0]
BitField.Notes: Delay read data, current delay value in the elements

BitField.Name: DRP_RWN
BitField.Notes: DRP read (0x1) or write (0x0) select (does not include GTX lanes).

BitField.Name: DRP_ADDRESS[11:0]
BitField.Notes: DRP address, designs that contain more than one DRP accessible primitives have selects based on the most significant bits (does not include GTX lanes).

BitField.Name: DRP_WDATA[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DRP write data (does not include GTX lanes).

BitField.Name: DRP_STATUS
BitField.Notes: If set indicates busy (access pending). The read data may not be valid if this bit is set (does not include GTX lanes).

BitField.Name: DRP_RDATA
BitField.Notes: DRP read data (does not include GTX lanes).

BitField.Name: UI_OVF
BitField.Notes: User Interface overflow. If set, indicates an overflow occured during data transfer at the user interface (FIFO interface). Software must write a 0x1 to clear this register bit.

BitField.Name: UI_UNF
BitField.Notes: User Interface underflow. If set, indicates an underflow occured during data transfer at the user interface (FIFO interface). Software must write a 0x1 to clear this register bit.

BitField.Name: UI_RESERVED
BitField.Notes: Reserved for backward compatibility.

BitField.Name: USR_CHANMAX[7:0]
BitField.Notes: This indicates the maximum number of inputs for the channel data multiplexers. User may add different processing modules post data capture as another input to this common multiplexer. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: ADC_DP_DISABLE
BitField.Notes: This indicates the data path disable setting of this pcore. If disabled, most of the HDL data path modules are disabled allowing an external core full access to the raw ADC data.

BitField.Name: PN_SEL
BitField.Notes: if set, enables an additional PN sequence monitor (shares same status signals).

BitField.Name: IQCOR_ENB
BitField.Notes: if set, enables IQ correction. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: DCFILT_ENB
BitField.Notes: if set, enables DC filter (to disable DC offset, set offset value to 0x0). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: FORMAT_SIGNEXT
BitField.Notes: if set, enables sign extension (applicable only in 2's complement mode). The data is always sign extended to the nearest byte boundary. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: FORMAT_TYPE
BitField.Notes: Select offset binary (0x1) or 2's complement (0x0) data type. This sets the incoming data type and is required by the post processing modules for any data conversion. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: FORMAT_ENABLE
BitField.Notes: Enable data format conversion (see register bits above). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: PN_TYPE
BitField.Notes: Selects PN type PN9 (0x0) or PN23 (0x1). If software is changing this bit, the OOS/ERR registers must be cleared before checking status again.

BitField.Name: ENABLE
BitField.Notes: If set, enables channel. A 0x0 to 0x1 transition transfers all the control signals to the respective channel processing module. If a channel is part of a complex signal (I/Q), even channel is the master and the odd channel is the slave. Though a single control is used, both must be individually selected. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: PN_ERR
BitField.Notes: PN errors. If set, indicates spurious mismatches in sync state. This bit is cleared if OOS is set and is only indicates errors when OOS is cleared.

BitField.Name: PN_OOS
BitField.Notes: PN Out Of Sync. If set, indicates an OOS status. OOS is set, if 64 consecutive patterns mismatch from the expected pattern. It is cleared, when 16 consecutive patterns match the expected pattern.

BitField.Name: OVER_RANGE
BitField.Notes: If set, indicates over range. Note that over range is independent of the data path, it indicates an over range over a data transfer period. Software must first clear this bit before initiating a transfer and monitor afterwards.

BitField.Name: DCFILT_OFFSET[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DC removal (if equipped) offset. This is a 2's complement number added to the incoming data to remove a known DC offset. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: DCFILT_COEFF[15:0]
BitField.Notes: DC removal filter (if equipped) coefficient. The format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: IQCOR_COEFF_1[15:0]
BitField.Notes: IQ correction (if equipped) coefficient. If scale & offset is implemented, this is the scale value and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). If matrix multiplication is used, this is the channel I coefficient and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: IQCOR_COEFF_2[15:0]
BitField.Notes: IQ correction (if equipped) coefficient. If scale & offset is implemented, this is the offset value and the format is 2's complement. If matrix multiplication is used, this is the channel Q coefficient and the format is 1.1.14 (sign, integer and fractional bits). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_BE
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- if set, indicates big endian (default is little endian). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_SIGNED
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- if set, indicates signed (2's complement) data (default is unsigned). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_SHIFT[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- the amount of right shift for actual samples within the total number of bits. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_TOTAL_BITS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- number of total bits used for a sample. The total number of bits must be an integer multiple of 8 (byte aligned). NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: USR_DATATYPE_BITS[7:0]
BitField.Notes: The user data type format- number of bits in a sample. This indicates the actual sample data bits. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: USR_DECIMATION_M[15:0]
BitField.Notes: This holds the user decimation M value of the channel that is currently being selected on the multiplexer above. The toal decimation factor is of the form M/N. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).

BitField.Name: USR_DECIMATION_N[15:0]
BitField.Notes: This holds the user decimation N value of the channel that is currently being selected on the multiplexer above. The toal decimation factor is of the form M/N. NOT-APPLICABLE if ADC_DP_DISABLE is set (0x1).
